intro: Lastrea acuminata, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. Lastrea acuminata typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and has ornamental value due to its delicate appearance.
